channel.title: Browser on ZAP
channel.description: Recent content in Browser on ZAP

item.title: Edge Support
item.description: ZAP now has “tier 1” support for Microsoft Edge, including exploring, crawling, and attacking.

item.title: Handling Modern Web Apps Better - Part 1
item.description: Introducing a new add-on which allows ZAP (and you) to see what is going on in the browser.

item.title: The Eval Villain Add-on
item.description: Eval Villain was recently added to the ZAP Marketplace. This add-on installs the Eval Villain web extension in Firefox and allows the inspection of arguments to arbitrary native JavaScript functions.

item.title: Launching Browsers with Extensions
item.description: You can now launch your favourite browsers from ZAP with your favourite extensions.

item.title: ZAP Browser Launch
item.description: We have just released a new feature for ZAP that allows you to launch browsers from within ZAP. The browsers are automatically configured to proxy via ZAP and ignore certificate warnings, making it much easier for people to get started with ZAP as well as for more experienced users who want to use ZAP with a variety of browsers. You can install and use Browser Launch right now via the ZAP Marketplace, which can be accessed via the ‘Manage Add-ons’ button in ZAP:
